sections.title: Introduction — GitHub Copilot integration with Visual Studio
sections.summary: Presenter introduces GitHub Copilot integration in Visual Studio and notes they are running a preview build which may include new changes.
key_actions: Open Visual Studio with GitHub Copilot enabled
Note that preview version is running (expect changes)

sections.title: Copilot core features — inline suggestions and next-edit
sections.summary: Demonstration of Copilot features: inline suggestions while coding and the 'next edit' suggestion. The presenter also checks usage/consumption metrics and pro plan usage for premium requests.
key_actions: Use inline suggestions as you type
Open consumption/usage panel to view pro plan usage (28% shown)

sections.title: Solution overview and Copilot working modes
sections.summary: High-level architecture: orchestrators, backend, frontend, models. Explanation that Copilot can help in two modes — 'Ask' mode to ask questions and an interactive 'Agent' mode for side-by-side coding assistance.
key_actions: Explain solution components (orchestrators, backend, frontend, models)
Switch/choose between Ask mode and Agent mode

sections.title: Selecting a model (example: choosing GPT-5)
sections.summary: Presenter demonstrates asking which OpenAI model the solution uses and selects a model (GPT‑5) from the available model list.
key_actions: Ask Copilot which OpenAI model is in use
Open model selector and choose GPT-5
ui_elements: Model list (e.g., GPT‑5, GPT‑4.1 mini, embeddings models)

sections.title: Copilot’s response — configured models and embeddings
sections.summary: Copilot reports that the AppHost (in the sample solution) defines specific models (GPT-4.1 mini and an embeddings model) and that the backend uses embeddings and chat features.
key_actions: Read Copilot's analysis of AppHost configuration
Confirm which models are configured for embeddings and chat

sections.title: Asking for upgrades and code changes (GPT-5, local models, C# and Bicep)
sections.summary: Presenter asks Copilot to create a plan to upgrade to GPT‑5 and to consider switching to local models. Copilot is described as capable of helping modify code (C#) and infrastructure-as-code (Bicep) files to implement upgrades.
key_actions: Request a plan to upgrade configured models to GPT-5
Ask about switching to local models
Have Copilot modify C# and Bicep files to implement changes
ui_elements: Ask interface for action requests (e.g., 'create a plan to upgrade')
Copilot automated code-edit capability / change suggestion pane

main_topics: GitHub Copilot integration with Visual Studio
Copilot inline suggestions and next-edit feature
Copilot working modes: Ask mode and Agent mode
Model selection (example: GPT-5) and configured models/embeddings
Copilot-assisted code and infrastructure changes (C#, Bicep)
Planning upgrades and switching to local models
